title: CNN's Town Hall Finished Dead Last In Average Cable News Viewers Wednesday Night
text:
CNN's seven-hour long climate change town hall, which was really just authoritarian wish list, featured nearly the entire slate of 2020 Democratic candidates and put a magnifying glass on their asinine plans to take over your life. The good news for these progressives is that the average voter likely did not see the spectacle. New data shows that CNN finished dead last amongst cable news networks on Wednesday night in terms of average viewers:

via The Hill: CNN averaged 1.1 million viewers from 5 p.m. to midnight, the hours devoted to back-to-back town halls by 10 Democratic contenders. MSNBC finished second with 1.7 million total viewers during the time period, with Fox News winning the time period with an average of 2.5 million. Both channels provided regular programming on Wednesday night.

As Bearing Arms' Tom Knighton sarcastically said, "You mean there wasn't a huge call for a 7-hour block of people telling us to give up burgers, straws, and our cars (among other things)? Frankly, I'm shocked."

You mean there wasn't a huge call for a 7-hour block of people telling us to give up burgers, straws, and our cars (among other things)?



Frankly, I'm shocked. https://t.co/kGqJGkYOvX — Tom Knighton (@TheTomKnighton) September 5, 2019

If you are one of the lucky ones who missed the television special, Katie summarized the extent of the town hall for you. "Democrats want to control every aspect of your life. How many kids you can have, how many guns you can have (zero), how much meat you can eat, what your home thermostat says, MADNESS," she tweeted.

"In other words: basically communism," Katie noted.
